span.strong: Governer Pritzker Issues a "Stay at Home" Order . . .

p.span: Therefore, Tuscola CUSD #301 Schools will be closed for the entire month of April

span.style: color: #202124; font-family: Roboto, Arial, sans-serif; letter-spacing: 0.2px; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; text-decoration: underline;

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; text-align: center;

span.style: color: #202124; font-family: 'Google Sans', Roboto, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14pt;

hr.p: April 17, 2020- “It ain’t over till it’s over!” These words were uttered by baseball legend Yogi Berra. Yogi is correct. School is not over. Physically being in a school building is over but the learning process is not over. Many of you know the Governor suspended onsite learning for the remainder of the year. We will continue with Remote Learning through May 22. Parents, we need you more than ever. Please encourage your child to be an active participant in their learning. Our teachers are finding creative ways to make sure students are engaged in learning. Keep encouraging your child to be mentally and physically active. Please contact your child’s teacher if you have questions or need ideas about learning at home. Our partnership will strengthen each child’s ability to handle this new sense of “normal.” We are in this together!

Class of 2020! I am sorry this is how you are experiencing an important end to one chapter of your life. It is an important chapter. Your class reunion, in five years, will be filled with some interesting conversation about the year you went to school for three-fourths of the year.

To all students, I am sorry you have to endure this. This is an unprecedented time. Please focus on the positives in your lives. I read an article that focused on a 75-year study at the University of Harvard which began in 1939. This study focused on how to have a lifetime of joy. The results did not say having the most money, the biggest house, the fastest car, or the most social media followers led to the greatest happiness. The 75-year study’s overwhelming conclusion is that good relationships keep you happy and healthy. I know your family can drive you crazy. I know I drive mine completely off the rails. Use this shelter in place time to strengthen each relationship you have. In the long run, that is all that matters.

It ain’t over till it’s over! My administrators and I are meeting next week. We have not given up on prom and graduation. As I type this letter, we are looking for a date in June to hold prom. Graduation will most likely be an outdoor graduation or we will hold graduation off-site. We have been discussing many options. The problem is we do not have all the information needed to make a final decision. When will the shelter in place end? What will the social distancing guidelines allow? There are many questions the administration team has. The IHSA will meet on Tuesday to determine what will happen with Spring activities. Look for an announcement from them next week. We will continue to distribute meals through May. I will send out another email next week with the link for May. We will also be discussing when and how students will be allowed into the buildings to gather their belongings. Look for further information next
week.

In conclusion, I want to say thank you to everyone in the great community of Tuscola. One of
the reasons I wanted to come back to Tuscola is the support the community gives each child.
This support is greatly appreciated! Please continue to email your child’s teachers,
administrators, and myself if you have further questions. We will do our best to answer your
question. Have a great weekend!

p.span: Sincerely,
Gary Alexander, Superintendent
Tuscola CUSD #301

span.strong: PICK-UP AND DROP-OFF OF LEARNING MATERIALS:

p.span: Pick up and drop off of learning materials at the high school will be from 8 am to 10 am. I want to give a HUGE pat on the back to our wonderful cafeteria staff. Robin Short, Kelly Campbell, and Sherry Carter do an outstanding job of preparing our meals to hand out. Jerri Quinn and Carrie Brian Miller also spend time helping out in the cafeteria getting the meals ready. The public usually has to see my ugly mug handing out the meals. The real reason the meal hand out is successful is those people. I would encourage those who have not signed up for the meals to do so. These meals are free to all Tuscola students. Click on the link to sign up. Breakfast and Lunch Form
REMOTE LEARNING: Please encourage your child to take advantage of
the online classroom times the teachers have. It is a great way to stay connected. Please email
your child’s teachers, principals, or myself if you have any questions. We will do our best to
answer them. Our wonderful staff will be answering phone calls Monday through Thursday from 8 am to Noon. We will use the following schedule to field phone calls.

span.strong: IF YOU HAVE A QUESTION, PLEASE CALL THE APPROPRIATE PHONE NUMBER ACCORDING TO

p.span: Monday from 8 to Noon please call the Unit Office at 217-253-4241

br.span: Tuesday from 8 to Noon please call North Ward at 217-253-2712
Wednesday from 8 to Noon please call Tuscola High School at 217-253-2377
Thursday from 8 to Noon please call East Prairie at 217-253-2828

p.span: INTERNET: In the teacher’s parking lot at TCHS and East Prairie, we will have an open internet source. If there are several people in your home and your device has power, you can sit in our parking lot and connect to the internet. At TCHS the parking lot is located near the football field. At East Prairie, it is located by the playground area.

margin-bottom: 6px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px;
p.span: This letter was sent thru TeacherEase on behalf of the Tuscola CUSD #301 District MTSS Leadership Team.
Dear Families/Guardians,

The Tuscola school district has provided supports for our students through Response to Intervention (RTI)/Multi-Tiered System of Support (MTSS) since 2010. Multi-Tiered System of Support (MTSS) is defined as: the practice of providing high-quality instruction/intervention matched to all student needs using data to facilitate educational decision-ma

king. MTSS provides an improved process and structure for school teams to design, implement, and evaluate both daily instruction and specific interventions. MTSS is a process that focuses on growth for all students.
The MTSS process includes:
K-8 students will be assessed 3 times a year using AimsWeb Plus K-12 intervention groups will be formed using data from assessments, grades, attendance, and behavior.
There are 3 Tiers of intervention groups:
In Tier I, all students receive high-quality curriculum and instruction in the general education classroom

In Tier II, the school provides supplemental instructional support, usually in small groups, to students who need support in addition to what they are receiving from the general curriculum (Tiger Time, Activity Period, Etc.).
In Tier III, intense instructional support is provided to students with the greatest needs, with frequent progress monitoring.

Once a month, teachers/staff will collaborate, evaluate student needs, and adjust interventions. These designated times include 7 shortened student attendance days in addition to the 3 scheduled Teacher Institute/SIP days.
Board Approved Days for the 2019-2020 School Year:
September 11
October 9
November 13
December 11

January 15
February 12
March 11
April 8
May 13

p.style: margin-bottom: 6px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px;
p.span: Tuscola CUSD #301 Board of Education finalized the schedule for these MTSS days during the May 28th Board Meeting. These days will be set for 2:00 pm dismissal schedules.
Please contact your student’s Principal with any questions or concerns. Further MTSS updates and information will be provided throughout the year.
North Ward - 217-253-2712
East Prairie - 217-253-2828

span.strong: We invite you to listen to memories shared by our first three "Voices".

div.p: Would you like to honor a family member or alumni member with a Memorial Tree? Contact us to find out how. Each tree has a plaque with your choice of custom message. Download the application form here.
